history.content:
When did you enter UC Berkeley? As in, began your undergraduate program?

It sounds like you had a situation where you got to take courses before your "officially" began — i.e. summer courses, concurrent enrollment, the freshmen edge program or something. I'm not sure that counts towards entering before fall 2015; you should check with a major advisor if you do have a special situation.

children.subject: you were admitted for fall 2015. the fact that you took summer classes early does not change that.
yes, but i chose to enter in summer 2015 instead..

Are summer courses not "officially" beginning? :( I wasn't in a special program, I signed up for summer courses like any other Berkeley student. Taking my first class in the summer, an R&C class, so my undergraduate program began in the summer. 

I see you emphasize entering UC Berkeley, is there a definition issue that I'm not aware of? Could you tell me what enter means then? I started in the summer, so I think I entered in the summer? :( i don't really understand what you mean at all :/

history.content: You were formally admitted to UC Berkeley for Fall 2015. This is the date on the top of your transcript. Therefore, you are expected to follow the Fall 2015 declaration process and meet the 3.30 GPA

If my first class at berkeley was summer 2015 (before fall 2015) do i get to use the 3.0 gpa cap instead lol. the 3.3 cap is really really stressing me out like seriously 

from the website: 

Instead, students intending this major are admitted as undeclared majors and, for students entering Berkeley in Fall 2015 or later, they must later declare the Computer Science major upon completion of specific technical prerequisite courses with a GPA of 3.30 or better.

I would actually fall under the 3.0 cap policy wouldn't I? :

Students entering UC Berkeley before fall 2015 must complete all 7 of the lower division course requirements with a cumulative GPA of at least 3.00 in order to petition for admission to the major.

Or am I misunderstanding it
history.subject: 3.3 LSCS question lol
